amendment.description: Amendment expresses a Sense of Congress that the Department of Transportation should utilize modeling and simulation technology to analyze federally funded highway and public transit projects to ensure that these projects will increase transportation capacity and safety, alleviate congestion, reduce travel time and environmental impact, and are as cost effective as practicable.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 17 printed in Part B of House Report 114-325 to include a sense of Congress that the Department of Transportation should utilize modeling and simulation technology to analyze federally funded highway and public transit projects to ensure that these projects will increase transportation capacity and safety, alleviate congestion, reduce travel time and environmental impact, and are as cost effective as practicable.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Scott (VA) amendment (A017) Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Amendment (A017) offered by Mr. Scott (VA) to the Rules amendment (A001).
Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Scott (VA) amendment (A017) Agreed to by voice vote.
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A017) offered by Mr. Scott (VA) to the Rules amendment (A001).
